article.title: Geography_of_Brunei
article.paragraph: Bruneiis inSoutheastern Asia, bordering theSouth China SeaandMalaysia. Its geographical coordinates areCoord430N11440E.
Brunei shares aconvert266kmmionBrunei-Malaysia Borderborderwith Malaysia and has aconvert161kmmioncoastline.
article.heading: Climate
article.paragraph: Theclimatein Brunei istropical climatetropicalTropical rainforest climateequatorialandhumid subtropicalat higher altitudes with heavy rainfall. Bandar Seri Begawan's climate is tropical equatorial with two seasons. Dry season is extremely hot (convert24to36CF1onor). Wet or rainy season is generally warm and wet (convert20to28CF1onor). Most of the country is a flatcoastal plainwithmountainsin the east and hilly lowland in the west. The lowest point is atsea leveland the highest isBukit Pagon(convert1850mft0onor).
article.heading: Climatic regions

list.listitem: Brunei-Muara DistrictandBandar Seri Begawanare humid tropical on the coastal and lower altitude north and Humid subtropical in central Brunei-Muara District. (convert20to36CFonor)
Tutong Districtistropical, Hot on the north and warm on the south. (convert22to32CF1onor)
Belait Districtis tropical, Hot on the north and slight warm on the south. (convert25to37CF1onor)
Temburong Districtishumid subtropicalon the higher altitude south and humid tropical on the coastal and lower altitude north. (convert18to29CFonor)
